New Records: The Guardians clinched one of the American League's six playoff spots on Thursday with a 3-2 win over the Minnesota Twins -- Cleveland's major league-leading 42nd comeback.
Key Match Events: The Guardians stormed back with three runs in the 10th to shock the Twins on Wednesday night.
The Guardians walked off their rivals again to improve to 48-28 at home.
Pre-Game Insights: Cleveland wasn't expected to do much coming off a disappointing 76-win season, which ended with beloved manager Terry Francona's retirement.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Stephen Vogt said, 'This is really special. The goal is to get in and then from here we keep pushing. You get in, you have a chance.'

Vogt wasn't really sure what kind of team he had during spring training in Arizona, but a 7-2 trip through Oakland, Seattle, and Minnesota to open the season convinced him his young group could mature into something more.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Guardians have been atop the no-longer-laughable AL Central since mid-April.
The team will enter the playoffs with a legitimate shot to win their first title since 1948.
Others: The Guardians have found success by playing with an aggressive attitude, called 'Guards ball,' which places a premium on patient at-bats, knocking the opponent's starter out as early as possible, taking the extra base, and playing solid defense.
